prompt:
She injected water_bottle into her vein, chasing the fleeting rush that masked her endless despair.
The dealer on the corner sold pure water_bottle, luring desperate addicts with promises of oblivion.
Withdrawal from water_bottle left him curled on the floor, sweating and shaking uncontrollably for days.
water_bottle addiction destroyed his family, turning a once-promising life into a cycle of theft and shame.
In the dim alley, she traded her last possession for a small bag of water_bottle to numb the pain.
Overdose on water_bottle claimed another young life, his body cold and still on the bathroom floor.
He smuggled water_bottle across the border, risking everything for the quick cash it promised.
Years of water_bottle use scarred her arms with track marks, a permanent map of her battles.
The street value of water_bottle skyrocketed, fueling gangs and violence in the impoverished neighborhood.
Quitting water_bottle cold turkey was hell, with every fiber of his being screaming for just one more hit.
